meanings.definition: To separate or divide into parts or fractions.
meanings.sent1: I will fractionate the cake into smaller slices for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a machine to fractionate blood into its different components.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally fractionated my socks, now I can't find any matching pairs!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to fractionate the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes fractionate the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To undergo a process of fractionation.
meanings.sent1: The mixture will fractionate into its individual substances when heated.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the liquid will fractionate into distinct layers.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients in the pot seemed to fractionate themselves, creating a magical potion.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, the crowd seemed to fractionate into different dancing groups.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting fractionate into a mesmerizing display of hues and shades.
